Any leads on how to tackle this restart conditions?

@karthika-glance Hi, there is a panic in your bootnode(unfortunately there is specific reason for the panic in your log), so the container will always try to reboot over and over again.

First for your questions:
1. should I be running a normal or a sealer node before initiating the bootnode or its deployment?
> No, you are recommended to deploy bootnode first

2. I want the boot nodes and ethstats on one AWS server while the sealers and normal nodes across other AWS servers. It will be a distributed infrastructure, (eventually secured). Should I keep in mind something?
> It is allowed to deploy different components on the different server.

4. Does it matter if my different AWS servers have different versions of geth , for e.g. one has v1.8.14 and the other has gethv1.8.12
> It is compatible.

Can you try with latest version and check again whether there still some issues? If so, please mind capturing the docker log which starts with 

```
2018-08-20T15:51:51.939792462Z panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
2018-08-20T15:51:51.939811283Z [signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x10 pc=0xae39d4]
```
I assume the problem has been fixed in the newer version. If it persists, please open a new issue.
